stencila 0.28.3

  • Reference

A HTTP server for a Host

Source: R/host-http-server.R
HostHttpServer.Rd

Normally there is no need to create a new HostHttpServer, instead use the start method of the host instance.

HostHttpServer

Format

R6Class.

Value

string A ticket

new()

host

The host to be served

address

The port to listen on. Default '127.0.0.1'

port

The port to listen on. Default 2000

authorization

Authorization for all requests. Default TRUE

start()

Start the server

stop()

Stop the server

handle()

Handle a HTTP request

route()

Route a HTTP request

options()

Handle a OPTIONS request

home()

Handle a request to `home`

static()

Handle a request for a static file

manifest()

Handle a request for the host's manifest

startup()

Handle a request to start and environment

post()

Handle a POST request

Handle a GET request

put()

Handle a PUT request

delete()

Handle a DELETE request

args()

Convert the body into a named list of arguments

accepts_json()

Does a request accept JSON?

ticket_create()

Create a ticket (a single-use access token)

ticket_check()

Check that a ticket is valid. If it is, then it is removed from the list of tickets and TRUE is returned. Otherwise, returns FALSE

ticketed_url()

Create a URL with a ticket query parameter so users can connect to this server

token_create()

Create a token (a multiple-use access token)

token_check()

Check that a token is valid.

error_403()

Generate a 403 error

error_404()

Generate a 404 error

error_500()

Generate a 500 error

url

The URL of the server, or NULL if not yet started
